thread.title: BRIEF-Casella Waste Systems Says Bethlehem Voters Not In Favor For NCES Landfill Expansion

title: BRIEF-Casella Waste Systems Says Bethlehem Voters Not In Favor For NCES Landfill Expansion

organizations.name: brief-casella waste systems says bethlehem voters

text: March 14, 2018 / 3:13 PM / Updated 29 minutes ago BRIEF-Casella Waste Systems Says Bethlehem Voters Not In Favor For NCES Landfill Expansion Reuters Staff 1 Min Read March 14 (Reuters) - Casella Waste Systems Inc: * CASELLA WASTE SYSTEMS - ON MARCH 13, BETHLEHEM, NH VOTERS DID NOT VOTE IN FAVOR TO CHANGE ZONING LAWS OF THE TOWN REGARDING ONE OF CO’S LANDFILLS * CASELLA WASTE SYSTEMS - SPECIFICALLY, BETHLEHEM VOTERS DID NOT ALLOW FOR A 70-ACRE LANDFILL EXPANSION AT CO’S NORTH COUNTRY ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES LANDFILL * CASELLA WASTE SYSTEMS SAYS ON MARCH 8, CO RECEIVED NOTICE FROM TOXIC ACTIONS CENTER AND CONSERVATION LAW FOUNDATION - SEC FILING * CASELLA WASTE SYSTEMS - RECEIVED NOTICE OF INTENT TO SUE COMPANY OVER ALLEGED VIOLATIONS OF CLEAN WATER ACT AT NCES LANDFILL * CASELLA WASTE SYSTEMS - ALSO, BETHLEHEM RESIDENTS DID NOT VOTE FOR TOWN'S BOARD OF SELECTMEN TO NEGOTIATE NEW LONG-TERM HOST COMMUNITY AGREEMENT WITH NCES Source text: ( bit.ly/2FGrRPm ) Further company coverage:
